answers.free_enjoyed: Loved a light white that tasted crisp and citrusy last summer.
answers.free_disliked: Heavy oaky buttery flavors give me a headache.
answers.free_contexts: Patio on a hot day, seafood dinners.

answers.free_enjoyed: Enjoy Barolo and Rioja reservas with dried cherry, leather, and spice.
Prefer Extra Brut grower Champagne; tension, oyster shell, fine mousse.
answers.free_disliked: Dosage above 6 g/L feels sweet; oxidative sherry notes only in context.
answers.free_descriptors: citrus zest, green apple, chalk, autolytic

answers.free_enjoyed: I love structured Napa cabs, Heitz c91 is a favorite with steak dinner. Northern Rhone Syrah with grilled food (black garlic steak kabobs). Enjoy merlot-leaning Bordeaux for contemplation. Elk Cove Pinot Gris is a comfort white; Sancerre with seafood and Caesar salad. Robust Pinot Noir or Rioja for pizza/burger nights. Warming up to round rosé.
answers.free_disliked: I don't love overly acidic Italian wines; extremely acidic or crisp whites can throw me off; prefer balanced whites.
answers.free_contexts: Making dinner at home, special occasions, date night, eating out, lunch rosé, friends and family over; wine fits the food; price varies.
answers.free_descriptors: structured, black fruit, pepper spice, mineral, savory, balanced white
